meanings.definition: To believe to be guilty or culpable.
meanings.sent1: The detective suspects the thief stole the jewels.
meanings.sent2: She suspects her brother ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent3: The cat suspects the dog is planning something mischievous.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds gathering in the sky suspects a storm is coming.
meanings.sent5: The teacher suspects the students are up to something during recess.

meanings.definition: A person who is believed to have committed a crime.
meanings.sent1: The suspects were taken into custody by the police.
meanings.sent2: The store owner pointed out the suspects in the security footage.
meanings.sent3: The suspects in the mystery novel turned out to be unexpected characters.
meanings.sent4: The suspects in the lineup all wore similar clothing to confuse the witness.
meanings.sent5: The suspects in the case had alibis that seemed too perfect to be true.
